docs.snippet: Snap Inc, owner of popular messaging app Snapchat, kicked off its first investor roadshow on Monday, looking to persuade London money managers to back its initial public offering in the face of concerns about its growth prospects, valuation and co...
docs.lead_paragraph: Snap Inc, owner of popular messaging app Snapchat, kicked off its first investor roadshow on Monday, looking to persuade London money managers to back its initial public offering in the face of concerns about its growth prospects, valuation and corporate governance.

headline.main: Snap Arrives in London to Woo Sceptical Investors Ahead of IPO
headline.print_headline: Snap Arrives in London to Woo Sceptical Investors Ahead of IPO

docs.snippet: A free and increasingly popular iPhone app called Snapchat allows a person to take and send a picture and control how long it is visible by the person who receives it, up to 10 seconds. After that, the picture disappears and can't be seen again....
docs.abstract: A free and increasingly popular iPhone app called Snapchat allows a person to take and send a picture and control how long it is visible by the person who receives it, up to 10 seconds. After that, the picture disappears and can't be seen again.

headline.main: Disruptions: Indiscreet Photos, Glimpsed Then Gone

docs.snippet: An investor committee that advises the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission will next week review if Snap Inc's decision to deny shareholders voting rights might also reduce the social media company's public disclosures on executive pay and oth...
docs.lead_paragraph: An investor committee that advises the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission will next week review if Snap Inc's decision to deny shareholders voting rights might also reduce the social media company's public disclosures on executive pay and other governance matters, the head of that committee told Reuters on Wednesday.

headline.main: Exclusive: SEC Advisory Committee to Question Snap's Transparency for Investors
headline.print_headline: Exclusive: SEC Advisory Committee to Question Snap's Transparency for Investors
